intro: Argostemma courtallense, commonly known as the Ceylon argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Sri Lanka and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
